body:
I'll take a look at the crash shortly, but I'm curious what kind of client
you're talking to? That looks like the client sent some very broken http2.

On Wed, Apr 29, 2015, 6:33 AM romange notifications@github.com wrote:

> it failed with the following errors:
> 
> E0429 13:24:22.785300033 1842 chttp2_transport.c:1327] ignoring out of
> order new stream request on server; last stream id=16777215, new stream
> id=60009136
> E0429 13:24:22.785365059 1842 stream_map.c:74] assertion failed: count ==
> 0 || keys[count - 1] < key
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1405.
I'll take a look then - any chance of sending a PR with your setup to save me reproing it?

Pr? Whats this?
On Apr 29, 2015 5:44 PM, "Craig Tiller" notifications@github.com wrote:

> I'll take a look then - any chance of sending a PR with your setup to save
> me reproing it?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1405#issuecomment-97453010.
Pull request :)
Or - you know, I'd happily take a zip file too.

Looks like that log message was bogus... fixed it with #1406 - we'll try to get that integrated quickly.
Hopefully that will give enough information that I can stop scratching my head over what's going on here.

Can you re-run your test at least with latest code @romange?
The error message has been improved, which I hope gives me a hint as to what the problem is.

Hi Craig
I'm inbutc+3  thats why im unresponsive during your day.

Will check today...
On Apr 30, 2015 1:04 AM, "Craig Tiller" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Can you re-run your test at least with latest code @romange
> https://github.com/romange?
> The error message has been improved, which I hope gives me a hint as to
> what the problem is.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1405#issuecomment-97601452.

No worries. Look forward to hearing how it goes!

On Wed, Apr 29, 2015, 10:36 PM romange notifications@github.com wrote:

> Hi Craig
> I'm inbutc+3 thats why im unresponsive during your day.
> 
> Will check today...
> On Apr 30, 2015 1:04 AM, "Craig Tiller" notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> > Can you re-run your test at least with latest code @romange
> > https://github.com/romange?
> > The error message has been improved, which I hope gives me a hint as to
> > what the problem is.
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1405#issuecomment-97601452.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1405#issuecomment-97667380.

Now it fails at the following staclktrace. Not sure how to compile grpc
with debug information to get more info..

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread 0x7ffff46d2700 (LWP 1425)]
0x00007ffff799714e in grpc_byte_buffer_reader_create () from
/usr/lib/libgrpc_unsecure.so.0
(gdb) where
#0  0x00007ffff799714e in grpc_byte_buffer_reader_create () from
/usr/lib/libgrpc_unsecure.so.0
#1  0x00007ffff7bce4a1 in grpc::DeserializeProto(grpc_byte_buffer_,
google::protobuf::Message_) () from /usr/lib/libgrpc++_unsecure.so.0
#2  0x00007ffff7bcfb4d in grpc::Server::RunRpc() () from
/usr/lib/libgrpc++_unsecure.so.0
#3  0x00007ffff7bd1cb6 in grpc::ThreadPool::ThreadFunc() () from
/usr/lib/libgrpc++_unsecure.so.0
#4  0x00007ffff6809bf0 in ?? () from
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#5  0x00007ffff6eab182 in start_thread (arg=0x7ffff46d2700) at
pthread_create.c:312
#6  0x00007ffff627747d in clone () at
../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone.S:111
(gdb) f 1
#1  0x00007ffff7bce4a1 in grpc::DeserializeProto(grpc_byte_buffer_,
google::protobuf::Message_) () from /usr/lib/libgrpc++_unsecure.so.0

wrote:

> No worries. Look forward to hearing how it goes!

## 

Best regards,
     Roman

here is another one. I know how to reproduce it now. All I need to do is it
to run one rpc client to my server and send the load test traffic
And then to run another one from other machine and connect it to the same
server.

(gdb) r
The program being debugged has been started already.
Start it from the beginning? (y or n) y
Starting program: /home/ubuntu/grpc_server --port 50001
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".

header

ok, I succeeded to deploy libraries with debug symbols.

here is the updated stacktrace (@git
commit ceb20ae45c0deaf10b386baf47f19e3c17149589)

#0  grpc_byte_buffer_reader_create (buffer=0x0) at
src/core/surface/byte_buffer_reader.c:46
#1  0x00007ffff7bcec81 in GrpcBufferReader (buffer=<optimized out>,
this=0x7ffff2ecfb20) at src/cpp/proto/proto_utils.cc:103
#2  grpc::DeserializeProto (buffer=<optimized out>, msg=msg@entry=0xfcebe0)
at src/cpp/proto/proto_utils.cc:162
#3  0x00007ffff7bd03ad in Run (this=0x7ffff2ecfcc0) at
src/cpp/server/server.cc:129
#4  grpc::Server::RunRpc (this=0xfe20b0) at src/cpp/server/server.cc:432
#5  0x00007ffff7bd2526 in operator() (this=0x7ffff2ecfe10) at
/usr/include/c++/4.8/functional:2464
#6  grpc::ThreadPool::ThreadFunc (this=0x1050000) at
src/cpp/server/thread_pool.cc:54
#7  0x00007ffff680abf0 in ?? () from
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#8  0x00007ffff6eac182 in start_thread (arg=0x7ffff2ed0700) at
pthread_create.c:312
#9  0x00007ffff627847d in clone () at
../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone.S:111

have fun :)
